desc: Show summary of options
Output version information

Suppress sending and receiving queue columns
Print each socket's data on a single line
Do not try to resolve service names
Try to resolve numeric address/ports
Display both listening and non-listening (for TCP this means established conn…
Display only listening sockets (these are omitted by default)
Display only TCP bound but inactive (not listening, connecting, etc
Show timer information.  For TCP protocol, the output format is: . RS
Show detailed socket information.  The output format is: . RS
Show socket memory usage.  The output format is: . RS
Show process using socket
Show thread using socket.  Implies  -p
Show internal TCP information.  Below fields may appear: . RS . P
Show ToS and priority information.  Below fields may appear: . RS . P
Show cgroup information.  Below fields may appear: . RS . P
Show internal tipc socket information
Attempts to forcibly close sockets
Print summary statistics
Continually display sockets as they are destroyed
As the  -p option but also shows process security context
As the  -Z option but also shows the socket context
Switch to the specified network namespace name
Show socket classic BPF filters (only administrators are allowed to get these…
Display only IP version 4 sockets (alias for -f inet)
Display only IP version 6 sockets (alias for -f inet6)
Display PACKET sockets (alias for -f link)
Display TCP sockets
Display UDP sockets
Display DCCP sockets
Display RAW sockets
Display Unix domain sockets (alias for -f unix)
Display SCTP sockets
Display tipc sockets (alias for -f tipc)
Display vsock sockets (alias for -f vsock)
Display XDP sockets (alias for -f xdp)
Display MPTCP sockets
Display inet socket options
Display sockets of type FAMILY
List of socket tables to dump, separated by commas
Do not display anything, just dump raw information about TCP sockets to FILE …
Read filter information from FILE
Pretty-print all the BPF socket-local data entries for each socket
Pretty-print the BPF socket-local data entries for the requested map ID
